name: Queso Dip
description: Such an easy Queso recipe!  Tons of flavor from the smoky, fiery chipotles but you can always dial back on them for a milder version.  mexicanplease.com

recipeInstructions.text: Start by rinsing and de-stemming the tomatoes, then roast them in a 400F oven for 15-20 minutes or until you need them.
recipeInstructions.name: Start by rinsing and de-stemming the tomatoes, then roast them in a 400F oven for 15-20 minutes or until you need them.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop 1/2 onion and 3 peeled garlic cloves.   Saute the onion in some oil over medium heat.  Once softened add the minced garlic and cook for 30-60 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop 1/2 onion and 3 peeled garlic cloves.   Saute the onion in some oil over medium heat.  Once softened add the minced garlic and cook for 30-60 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the majority of the onion-garlic mixture to a blender.   I usually keep some of it in the saucepan so that there are chunks in the Queso but this is optional.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the majority of the onion-garlic mixture to a blender.   I usually keep some of it in the saucepan so that there are chunks in the Queso but this is optional.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 8 oz. cream cheese, 1/2 cup milk, 2 cups shredded cheese, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to the saucepan.  Melt over medium-low heat, stirring regularly.  Once it's all melted you can take a taste to get a sense of the salt level, adding more if necessary.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 8 oz. cream cheese, 1/2 cup milk, 2 cups shredded cheese, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to the saucepan.  Melt over medium-low heat, stirring regularly.  Once it's all melted you can take a taste to get a sense of the salt level, adding more if necessary.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the roasted tomatoes to the blender along with 3-4 chipotles in adobo (the onion-garlic mixture should already be in the blender).  I usually remove the stems and seeds from the chipotles.   Combine well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the roasted tomatoes to the blender along with 3-4 chipotles in adobo (the onion-garlic mixture should already be in the blender).  I usually remove the stems and seeds from the chipotles.   Combine well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the blended tomato-chipotle mixture to the Queso and combine well.  And now take another taste!
recipeInstructions.name: Add the blended tomato-chipotle mixture to the Queso and combine well.  And now take another taste!

recipeInstructions.text: You can optionally add 1/2 teaspoon Mexican oregano and a pinch of cumin at this point.  You can also add more chipotles or some adobo sauce if you want more heat.
recipeInstructions.name: You can optionally add 1/2 teaspoon Mexican oregano and a pinch of cumin at this point.  You can also add more chipotles or some adobo sauce if you want more heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately with plenty of tortilla chips.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately with plenty of tortilla chips.

recipeInstructions.text: Store leftovers in the fridge.  To reheat simply add the Queso to a saucepan along with a splash of water or milk and warm up over medium-low heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Store leftovers in the fridge.  To reheat simply add the Queso to a saucepan along with a splash of water or milk and warm up over medium-low heat.
